title: Easy Baked Oatmeal Recipe
description: An oatmeal breakfast that is more like a coffee cake. Its easy and my family just loves this! Its a one of our breakfast favorites.

Recipes Easy Baked Oatmeal 3.8 (39) 33 Reviews 4 Photos An oatmeal breakfast that is more like a coffee cake. Its easy and my family just loves this! Its a one of our breakfast favorites. Submitted by KAPUANANI468 Updated on January 7, 2022 Save Rate Print Share Close Add Photo 4 4 Prep Time: 15 mins Cook Time: 30 mins Total Time: 45 mins Servings: 8 Yield: 8 servings Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 8 servings 6 cups quick cooking oats ¾ cup packed brown sugar 1 teaspoon salt 1 ½ teaspoons baking powder 6 eggs 2 cups milk 1 ½ teaspoons vanilla extract ⅔ cup canola oil ½ cup coarsely chopped walnuts Directions Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Grease and flour a 9x13 inch baking pan. In a large bowl, stir together the oats, brown sugar, salt and baking powder. In a separate medium bowl, stir together the eggs, milk, vanilla and canola oil. Pour the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients, and stir until well blended. Spoon into the prepared baking pan, and spread evenly. Sprinkle walnuts over the top. Bake for 30 minutes in the preheated oven, or until a knife inserted into the center comes out clean. I Made It Print 46 home cooks made it! Nutrition Facts (per serving) 610 Calories 32g Fat 66g Carbs 16g Protein Show Full Nutrition Label Hide Full Nutrition Label Nutrition Facts Servings Per Recipe 8 Calories 610 % Daily Value * Total Fat 32g 42% Saturated Fat 4g 22% Cholesterol 144mg 48% Sodium 445mg 19% Total Carbohydrate 66g 24% Dietary Fiber 7g 24% Total Sugars 24g Protein 16g 32% Vitamin C 0mg 0% Calcium 185mg 14% Iron 4mg 21% Potassium 424mg 9% * Percent Daily Values are based on a 2,000 calorie diet. Your daily values may be higher or lower depending on your calorie needs. ** Nutrient information is not available for all ingredients. Amount is based on available nutrient data. (-) Information is not currently available for this nutrient. If you are following a medically restrictive diet, please consult your doctor or registered dietitian before preparing this recipe for personal consumption. Add Your Photo Photos of Easy Baked Oatmeal 01 of 04 Photo by  Allrecipes Member 02 of 04 Photo by  Carl Me 03/22/2016 03 of 04 Photo by  Ildefonso 08/11/2009 I have been eating oatmeal for breakfast daily. I wanted to try this as an easy way to make a lot ahead of time. It sure does make a lot!! As with the previous reviewer I used almonds instead of walnuts. I also sprinkled cinnamon on top for extra flavor. The texture of this is much more dense and chewy than a bowl of oatmeal. I have been heating up in the microwave with milk. With the warm milk it reminds me of Indian pudding, an old settler recipe which I used to love as a child. 1 You’ll Also Love Kid's Favorite Baked Oatmeal 18 Ratings Maple and Brown Sugar Oatmeal 37 Ratings Bowl of Oatmeal Cookie 16 Ratings Healthy German Chocolate Cake Oatmeal 5 Ratings Peanut Butter and Preserves Oatmeal 4 Ratings Bright-Idea Oatmeal 2 Ratings Quick and Easy Peanut Butter Oatmeal 34 Ratings Backpacking Oatmeal 2 Ratings Classic Overnight Oats 22 Ratings Instant Oatmeal Mix 29 Ratings Healthy Apple Spice Baked Oatmeal 8 Ratings Chocolate Banana Oatmeal Porridge 55 Ratings Spicy Gingerbread Overnight Oats 6 Ratings Sweet Coconut Oatmeal 19 Ratings Protein Powerhouse Baked Oatmeal 16 Ratings Overnight Coconut Pecan Steel Cut Oats 69 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family. name: KAPUANANI468
instructions: Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Grease and flour a 9x13 inch baking pan.;In a large bowl, stir together the oats, brown sugar, salt and baking powder. In a separate medium bowl, stir together the eggs, milk, vanilla and canola oil. Pour the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients, and stir until well blended. Spoon into the prepared baking pan, and spread evenly. Sprinkle walnuts over the top.;Bake for 30 minutes in the preheated oven, or until a knife inserted into the center comes out clean.
